name: denuded
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
denude
to remove the covering of something, especially land: The countryside has been denuded by war. Drought and years of heavy grazing by sheep have completely denuded the hills of grass.
to remove a valuable possession or quality: Any further cuts in the country's armed forces would leave its defences dangerously denuded.
